list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
On average it takes 5 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

contents.description: Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
This section asks for general information on your business's trading status.
This section asks for information about your business's stockpiling and stock levels.
This section asks for information about:

contents.description: We are asking this to understand how the UK Government's target of net zero carbon emissions may be affecting business's actions in relation to climate change.
This section asks for information about your business's use of artificial intelligence technologies.

The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.

definitions.title: What we mean by assessing climate risks

contents.description: This refers to considering any of the following three main elements of climate risk:

list: assessing potential hazards, for example extreme climate-induced events
gauging exposure, for example the susceptibility to that hazard based on location, age, or quality of asset
judging vulnerability, for example taking into account demographic or socioeconomic factors that might make it harder to prepare or respond, adaptive capacity
